page.title: 15PLOCKTON REGATTA.
page.content: { PLOCKTON SMALL BOAT SAILING CLUB}WAS FORMED IN{1933.}THROUGHOUT THE SUMMER RACES ARE HELD EVERY WEEK BUT DURING THE{REGATTA FORTNIGHT}THERE ARE RACES EVERY DAY.THERE ARE ABOUT 20 BOATS IN 2 CLASSES IN THE CLUB.THESE ARE CENTRE BOARD DINGHIES AND A LOCAL CLASS OF BOATS.THE LOCAL CLASS ARE ALL CLINKER BUILT,ABOUT 16ft LONG,WITH ONLY A 6in. KEEL.THE LAST EVENT OF REGATTA IS THE CHILDREN'S{RAGAMUFFINS RACE.}THE CHILDREN HAVE TO MAKE,DECORATE AND PAINT LARGE SQUARE SAILS AND RACE THE BOATS ACROSS THE BAY.THE LONGEST RACE OF REGATTA IS ABOUT 16 MILES AND IS HELD ON A SATURDAY.THERE IS ALWAYS A CLUB{CONCERT}WHERE THE CUPS AND TROPHIES ARE PRESENTED.THE TURN THAT IS LOOKED FORWARD TO MOST IS THE SKIPPERS'{DEEP SEA CHOIR.}THEY CAN'T SING VERY WELL,BUT USUALLY THEY MAKE YOU LAUGH.
